highscore

Class HighScoreBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • highscore.HighScoreBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class HighScoreBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    File: HighScoreBoard.java This class encompasses and stores all the logic behind the high score board to be used to record and display top scoring attempts of user's of Minesweeper. This class implements the Serializable interface which is used to save the current state of this board to be used on subsequent game plays of Minesweeper. This class is saved as "highscores.dat" in other classes and will be found on a user's local directory when the first successful run of the game is complete. This file can be deleted by going to the file directory this program resides and moving the file to trash.
    Author:
    Caroline Hyland, James O'Connell, Nicholas Leluan, Christian Trejo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HighScoreBoard()
      Zero argument constructor Creates an instance of the HighScoreBoard class that will hold all modes as String keys and the values associated to the leader board of that particular game difficulty

      java.util.ArrayList<PlayerProfile> getTopTen(java.lang.String mode)
      Method that gets the Top Ten highest scored scores for a particular mode For the purposes of this game, the top 10 will consist of the lowest scores achieved as the nature of the game is to complete the puzzle in as little time as possible

    • Method Detail

      • addNewScore

        public void addNewScore(java.lang.String name,
                        int score,
                        java.lang.String mode)
        Adds a new record into the corresponding High Score Board TreeMap Method first checks to see if the passed in mode is currently in the allBoard HashMap or not. If the game mode/difficulty is not in the allBoard HashMap, it is added. A new PlayerProfile class is created which contains methods within it that give information about the particular player who completed the game.
        Parameters:
        name - String name of the player to be associated with
        score - int value of the score the player achieved
        mode - String value of the difficulty mode that the player completed

      • getTopTen

        public java.util.ArrayList<PlayerProfile> getTopTen(java.lang.String mode)
        Method that gets the Top Ten highest scored scores for a particular mode For the purposes of this game, the top 10 will consist of the lowest scores achieved as the nature of the game is to complete the puzzle in as little time as possible
        Parameters:
        mode - String representing the difficulty/mode that we want to return the top 10 for
        Returns:
        ArrayList of PlayerProfile objects that will consists of the top 10 scores for the given difficulty mode
